ecs_taskdefinition.description: Registers or deregisters task definitions in the Amazon Web Services (AWS) EC2 Container Service (ECS)

family.description: A Name that would be given to the task definition

task_role_arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role that containers in this task can assume. All containers in this task are granted the permissions that are specified in this role.

network_mode.description:
Default: bridge

The Docker networking mode to use for the containers in the task.

state.description: State whether the task definition should exist or be deleted

arn.description: The arn of the task description to delete

volumes.description: A list of names of volumes to be attached

revision.description: A revision number for the task definition

selinux.description: Configures the SELinux mode and policy. A reboot may be required after usage. Ansible will not issue this reboot but will let you know when it is required.

policy.description: name of the SELinux policy to use (example: C(targeted)) will be required if state is not C(disabled)

state.description: The SELinux mode

conf.description:
Default: /etc/selinux/config

path to the SELinux configuration file, if non-standard

consul.description:
Registers services and checks for an agent with a consul cluster. A service is some process running on the agent node that should be advertised by consul's discovery mechanism. It may optionally supply a check definition, a periodic service test to notify the consul cluster of service's health.
Checks may also be registered per node e.g. disk usage, or cpu usage and notify the health of the entire node to the cluster. Service level checks do not require a check name or id as these are derived by Consul from the Service name and id respectively by appending 'service:' Node level checks require a check_name and optionally a check_id.
Currently, there is no complete way to retrieve the script, interval or ttl metadata for a registered check. Without this metadata it is  not possible to tell if the data supplied with ansible represents a change to a check. As a result this does not attempt to determine changes and will always report a changed occurred. An api method is planned to supply this metadata so at that stage change management will be added.
See http://consul.io for more details.

service_address.description:
Default: None

the address to advertise that the service will be listening on. This value will be passed as the I(Address) parameter to Consul's U(/v1/agent/service/register) API method, so refer to the Consul API documentation for further details.

http.description:
Default: None

checks can be registered with an http endpoint. This means that consul will check that the http endpoint returns a successful http status. Interval must also be provided with this option.

tags.description:
Default: None

a list of tags that will be attached to the service registration.

check_name.description:
Default: None

a name for the service check, defaults to the check id. required if standalone, ignored if part of service definition.

service_name.description: Unique name for the service on a node, must be unique per node, required if registering a service. May be omitted if registering a node level check

notes.description:
Default: None

Notes to attach to check when registering it.

script.description:
Default: None

the script/command that will be run periodically to check the health of the service. Scripts require an interval and vise versa

token.description:
Default: None

the token key indentifying an ACL rule set. May be required to register services.

interval.description:
Default: None

the interval at which the service check will be run. This is a number with a s or m suffix to signify the units of seconds or minutes e.g 15s or 1m. If no suffix is supplied, m will be used by default e.g. 1 will be 1m. Required if the script param is specified.

check_id.description:
Default: None

an ID for the service check, defaults to the check name, ignored if part of a service definition.

host.description:
Default: localhost

host of the consul agent defaults to localhost

state.description: register or deregister the consul service, defaults to present

service_port.description: the port on which the service is listening required for registration of a service, i.e. if service_name or service_id is set

timeout.description:
Default: None

A custom HTTP check timeout. The consul default is 10 seconds. Similar to the interval this is a number with a s or m suffix to signify the units of seconds or minutes, e.g. 15s or 1m.

ttl.description:
Default: None

checks can be registered with a ttl instead of a script and interval this means that the service will check in with the agent before the ttl expires. If it doesn't the check will be considered failed. Required if registering a check and the script an interval are missing Similar to the interval this is a number with a s or m suffix to signify the units of seconds or minutes e.g 15s or 1m. If no suffix is supplied, m will be used by default e.g. 1 will be 1m

service_id.description:
Default: service_name if supplied

the ID for the service, must be unique per node, defaults to the service name if the service name is supplied

scheme.description:
Default: http

the protocol scheme on which the consul agent is running

validate_certs.description:
Default: True

whether to verify the tls certificate of the consul agent

port.description:
Default: 8500

the port on which the consul agent is running

alternatives.description:
Manages symbolic links using the 'update-alternatives' tool
Useful when multiple programs are installed but provide similar functionality (e.g. different editors).

priority.description:
Default: 50

The priority of the alternative

path.description: The path to the real executable that the link should point to.

link.description:
The path to the symbolic link that should point to the real executable.
This option is required on RHEL-based distributions

name.description: The generic name of the link.

set_stats.description: This module allows setting/accumulating stats on the current ansible run, either per host of for all hosts in the run.

aggregate.description:
Default: True

boolean that indicates if the provided value is aggregated to the existing stat C(yes) or will replace it C(no)

data.description: A dictionary of which each key represents a stat (or variable) you want to keep track of

per_host.description: boolean that indicates if the stats is per host or for all hosts in the run.

gce_lb.description: This module can create and destroy Google Compute Engine C(loadbalancer) and C(httphealthcheck) resources.  The primary LB resource is the C(load_balancer) resource and the health check parameters are all prefixed with I(httphealthcheck). The full documentation for Google Compute Engine load balancing is at U(https://developers.google.com/compute/docs/load-balancing/).  However, the ansible module simplifies the configuration by following the libcloud model. Full install/configuration instructions for the gce* modules can be found in the comments of ansible/test/gce_tests.py.

httphealthcheck_host.description: host header to pass through on HTTP check requests

protocol.description:
Default: tcp

the protocol used for the load-balancer packet forwarding, tcp or udp

name.description: name of the load-balancer resource

external_ip.description: the external static IPv4 (or auto-assigned) address for the LB

region.description: the GCE region where the load-balancer is defined

httphealthcheck_unhealthy_count.description:
Default: 2

number of consecutive failed checks before marking a node unhealthy

httphealthcheck_healthy_count.description:
Default: 2

number of consecutive successful checks before marking a node healthy

pem_file.description: path to the pem file associated with the service account email This option is deprecated. Use 'credentials_file'.

httphealthcheck_path.description:
Default: /

the url path to use for HTTP health checking

port_range.description: the port (range) to forward, e.g. 80 or 8000-8888 defaults to all ports

state.description:
Default: present

desired state of the LB

httphealthcheck_timeout.description:
Default: 5

the timeout in seconds before a request is considered a failed check

members.description: a list of zone/nodename pairs, e.g ['us-central1-a/www-a', ...]

credentials_file.description: path to the JSON file associated with the service account email

httphealthcheck_port.description:
Default: 80

the TCP port to use for HTTP health checking

httphealthcheck_name.description: the name identifier for the HTTP health check

nodes.description: a list of zone/nodename pairs, e.g ['us-central1-a/www-a', ...]

httphealthcheck_interval.description:
Default: 5

the duration in seconds between each health check request

state.description: The desired state of the cluster

repeat.description: The number of times to wait for the cluster to have an instance

name.description: The cluster name

os_keystone_domain_facts.description: Retrieve facts about a one or more OpenStack domains

name.description: Name or ID of the domain

filters.description:
Default: None

A dictionary of meta data to use for further filtering.  Elements of this dictionary may be additional dictionaries.

win_say.description: Uses .NET libraries to convert text to speech and optionally play .wav sounds.  Audio Service needs to be running and some kind of speakers or headphones need to be attached to the windows target(s) for the speech to be audible.

start_sound_path.description: Full path to a C(.wav) file containing a sound to play before the text is spoken.  Useful on conference calls to alert other speakers that ansible has something to say.

msg_file.description:
Default: none

Full path to a windows format text file containing the text to be spokend.  Use either msg or msg_file.  Optional so that you can use this module just to play sounds.

end_sound_path.description: Full path to a C(.wav) file containing a sound to play after the text has been spoken.  Useful on conference calls to alert other speakers that ansible has finished speaking.

msg.description:
Default: none

The text to be spoken.  Use either msg or msg_file.  Optional so that you can use this module just to play sounds.

voice.description:
Default: system default voice

Which voice to use. See notes for how to discover installed voices.  If the requested voice is not available the default voice will be used. Example voice names from Windows 10 are 'Microsoft Zira Desktop' and 'Microsoft Hazel Desktop'.

speech_speed.description: How fast or slow to speak the text.  Must be an integer value in the range -10 to 10.  -10 is slowest, 10 is fastest.

os_recordset.description: Manage OpenStack DNS recordsets. Recordsets can be created, deleted or updated. Only the I(records), I(description), and I(ttl) values can be updated.

name.description: Name of the recordset

zone.description: Zone managing the recordset

state.description:
Default: present

Should the resource be present or absent.

ttl.description:
Default: None

TTL (Time To Live) value in seconds

description.description:
Default: None

Description of the recordset

junos_rpc.description: Sends a request to the remote device running JUNOS to execute the specified RPC using the NetConf transport.  The reply is then returned to the playbook in the c(xml) key.  If an alternate output format is requested, the reply is transformed to the requested output.

output.description:
Default: xml

The C(output) argument specifies the desired output of the return data.  This argument accepts one of C(xml), C(text), or C(json).  For C(json), the JUNOS device must be running a version of software that supports native JSON output.

rpc.description: The C(rpc) argument specifies the RPC call to send to the remote devices to be executed.  The RPC Reply message is parsed and the contents are returned to the playbook.

args.description: The C(args) argument provides a set of arguments for the RPC call and are encoded in the request message.  This argument accepts a set of key=value arguments.

kernel_blacklist.description: Add or remove kernel modules from blacklist.

blacklist_file.description: If specified, use this blacklist file instead of C(/etc/modprobe.d/blacklist-ansible.conf).

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the module should be present in the blacklist or absent.

name.description: Name of kernel module to black- or whitelist.

pn_ospf.description:
Execute vrouter-ospf-add, vrouter-ospf-remove command.
This command adds/removes Open Shortest Path First(OSPF) routing protocol to a virtual router(vRouter) service.

pn_ospf_area.description: Stub area number for the configuration. Required for vrouter-ospf-add.

pn_clipassword.description: Provide login password if user is not root.

pn_vrouter_name.description: Specify the name of the vRouter.

pn_network_ip.description: Specify the network IP (IPv4 or IPv6) address.

pn_cliusername.description: Provide login username if user is not root.

state.description:
Default: present

Assert the state of the ospf. Use 'present' to add ospf and 'absent' to remove ospf.

pn_cliswitch.description: Target switch to run the CLI on.

htpasswd.description:
Add and remove username/password entries in a password file using htpasswd.
This is used by web servers such as Apache and Nginx for basic authentication.

username.description: User name to add or remove

name.description: User name to add or remove

dest.description: Path to the file that contains the usernames and passwords

create.description:
Default: yes

Used with C(state=present). If specified, the file will be created if it does not already exist. If set to "no", will fail if the file does not exist

destfile.description: Path to the file that contains the usernames and passwords

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the user entry should be present or not

path.description: Path to the file that contains the usernames and passwords

password.description:
Password associated with user.
Must be specified if user does not exist yet.

crypt_scheme.description:
Default: apr_md5_crypt

Encryption scheme to be used.  As well as the four choices listed here, you can also use any other hash supported by passlib, such as md5_crypt and sha256_crypt, which are linux passwd hashes.  If you do so the password file will not be compatible with Apache or Nginx

gce_tag.description: This module can add or remove tags U(https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/instances/#tags) to/from GCE instance.

zone.description:
Default: us-central1-a

the zone of the disk specified by source

tags.description: comma-separated list of tags to add or remove

pem_file.description: path to the pem file associated with the service account email

instance_name.description: the name of the GCE instance to add/remove tags

state.description:
Default: present

desired state of the tags

zabbix_maintenance.description: This module will let you create Zabbix maintenance windows.

timeout.description:
Default: 10

The timeout of API request (seconds).

name.description: Unique name of maintenance window.

url.description: Url of Zabbix server, with protocol (http or https). C(url) is an alias for C(server_url).

login_user.description: Zabbix user name.

server_url.description: Url of Zabbix server, with protocol (http or https). C(url) is an alias for C(server_url).

host_names.description: Hosts to manage maintenance window for. Separate multiple hosts with commas. C(host_name) is an alias for C(host_names). B(Required) option when C(state) is I(present) and no C(host_groups) specified.

host_group.description: Host groups to manage maintenance window for. Separate multiple groups with commas. C(host_group) is an alias for C(host_groups). B(Required) option when C(state) is I(present) and no C(host_names) specified.

state.description:
Default: present

Create or remove a maintenance window.

host_name.description: Hosts to manage maintenance window for. Separate multiple hosts with commas. C(host_name) is an alias for C(host_names). B(Required) option when C(state) is I(present) and no C(host_groups) specified.

host_groups.description: Host groups to manage maintenance window for. Separate multiple groups with commas. C(host_group) is an alias for C(host_groups). B(Required) option when C(state) is I(present) and no C(host_names) specified.

login_password.description: Zabbix user password.

collect_data.description:
Default: true

Type of maintenance. With data collection, or without.

minutes.description:
Default: 10

Length of maintenance window in minutes.

desc.description:
Default: Created by Ansible

Short description of maintenance window.

cl_img_install.description: install a different version of Cumulus Linux in the inactive slot. For more details go the Image Management User Guide at U(http://docs.cumulusnetworks.com/).

src.description: The full path to the Cumulus Linux binary image. Can be a local path, http or https URL. If the code version is in the name of the file, the module will assume this is the version of code you wish to install.

version.description:
Default: None

Inform the module of the exact version one is installing. This overrides the automatic check of version in the file name. For example, if the binary file name is called CumulusLinux-2.2.3.bin, and version is set to '2.5.0', then the module will assume it is installing '2.5.0' not '2.2.3'. If version is not included, then the module will assume '2.2.3' is the version to install.

switch_slot.description:
Default: no

Switch slots after installing the image. To run the installed code, reboot the switch.

panos_security_policy.description: Security policies allow you to enforce rules and take action, and can be as general or specific as needed. The policy rules are compared against the incoming traffic in sequence, and because the first rule that matches the traffic is applied, the more specific rules must precede the more general ones.

username.description:
Default: admin

Username credentials to use for auth unless I(api_key) is set.

spyware.description:
Default: None

Name of the already defined spyware profile.

hip_profiles.description:
Default: any

If you are using GlobalProtect with host information profile (HIP) enabled, you can also base the policy on information collected by GlobalProtect. For example, the user access level can be determined HIP that notifies the firewall about the user's local configuration.

file_blocking.description:
Default: None

Name of the already defined file_blocking profile.

tag.description:
Default: None

Administrative tags that can be added to the rule. Note, tags must be already defined.

log_start.description: Whether to log at session start.

description.description:
Default: None

Description for the security rule.

to_zone.description:
Default: any

List of destination zones.

source.description:
Default: any

List of source addresses.

destination.description:
Default: any

List of destination addresses.

from_zone.description:
Default: any

List of source zones.

source_user.description:
Default: any

Use users to enforce policy for individual users or a group of users.

url_filtering.description:
Default: None

Name of the already defined url_filtering profile.

group_profile.description:
Default: None

Security profile group that is already defined in the system. This property supersedes antivirus, vulnerability, spyware, url_filtering, file_blocking, data_filtering, and wildfire_analysis properties.

api_key.description: API key that can be used instead of I(username)/I(password) credentials.

wildfire_analysis.description:
Default: None

Name of the already defined wildfire_analysis profile.

devicegroup.description:
Default: None

Device groups are used for the Panorama interaction with Firewall(s). The group must exists on Panorama. If device group is not define we assume that we are contacting Firewall.

data_filtering.description:
Default: None

Name of the already defined data_filtering profile.

antivirus.description:
Default: None

Name of the already defined antivirus profile.

password.description: Password credentials to use for auth unless I(api_key) is set.

ip_address.description: IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device being configured.

rule_type.description:
Default: universal

Type of security rule (version 6.1 of PanOS and above).

vulnerability.description:
Default: None

Name of the already defined vulnerability profile.

action.description:
Default: allow

Action to apply once rules maches.

commit.description:
Default: True

Commit configuration if changed.

log_end.description:
Default: True

Whether to log at session end.

infini_pool.description: This module to creates, deletes or modifies pools on Infinibox.

ssd_cache.description:
Default: True

Enable/Disable SSD Cache on Pool

state.description:
Default: present

Creates/Modifies Pool when present or removes when absent

vsize.description: Pool Virtual Capacity in MB, GB or TB units. If pool vsize is not set on pool creation, Virtual Capacity will be equal to Physical Capacity. See examples.

name.description: Pool Name

size.description: Pool Physical Capacity in MB, GB or TB units. If pool size is not set on pool creation, size will be equal to 1TB. See examples.

nxos_gir_profile_management.description: Manage a maintenance-mode or normal-mode profile with configuration commands that can be applied during graceful removal or graceful insertion.

include_defaults.description: Specify to retrieve or not the complete running configuration for module operations.

commands.description: List of commands to be included into the profile.

config.description: Specify the configuration string to be used for module operations.

mode.description: Configure the profile as Maintenance or Normal mode.

state.description:
Default: present

Specify desired state of the resource.

source_addr.description: Local source address from which NTP messages are sent.

prefer.description: Makes given NTP server or peer the preferred NTP server or peer for the device.

state.description:
Default: present

Manage the state of the resource.

vrf_name.description: Makes the device communicate with the given NTP server or peer over a specific VRF.

key_id.description: Authentication key identifier to use with given NTP server or peer.

source_int.description: Local source interface from which NTP messages are sent. Must be fully qualified interface name.

cs_snapshot_policy.description: Create, update and delete volume snapshot policies.

project.description: Name of the project the volume is related to.

domain.description: Domain the volume is related to.

interval.description:
Default: daily

Interval of the snapshot.

schedule.description:
Time the snapshot is scheduled. Required if C(state=present).
Format for C(interval_type=HOURLY): C(MM)
Format for C(interval_type=DAILY): C(MM:HH)
Format for C(interval_type=WEEKLY): C(MM:HH:DD (1-7))
Format for C(interval_type=MONTHLY): C(MM:HH:DD (1-28))

interval_type.description:
Default: daily

Interval of the snapshot.

vm.description:
Name of the instance to select the volume from.
Use C(volume_type) if VM has a DATADISK and ROOT volume.
In case of C(volume_type=DATADISK), additionally use C(device_id) if VM has more than one DATADISK volume.
Either C(volume) or C(vm) is required.

time_zone.description:
Default: UTC

Specifies a timezone for this command.

volume.description:
Name of the volume.
Either C(volume) or C(vm) is required.

state.description:
Default: present

State of the snapshot policy.

vpc.description: Name of the vpc the instance is deployed in.

account.description: Account the volume is related to.

timezone.description:
Default: UTC

Specifies a timezone for this command.

device_id.description:
ID of the device on a VM the volume is attached to.
This will only be considered if VM has multiple DATADISK volumes.

nxos_install_os.description: Install an operating system by setting the boot options like boot image and kickstart image.

system_image_file.description: Name of the system (or combined) image file on flash.

kickstart_image_file.description: Name of the kickstart image file on flash.

xml.description: XML document used with the define command.

name.description: name of the storage pool being managed. Note that pool must be previously defined with xml.

state.description: specify which state you want a storage pool to be in. If 'active', pool will be started. If 'present', ensure that pool is present but do not change its state; if it's missing, you need to specify xml argument. If 'inactive', pool will be stopped. If 'undefined' or 'absent', pool will be removed from I(libvirt) configuration. If 'deleted', pool contents will be deleted and then pool undefined.

command.description: in addition to state management, various non-idempotent commands are available. See examples.

mode.description: Pass additional parameters to 'build' or 'delete' commands.

autostart.description: Specify if a given storage pool should be started automatically on system boot.

pool.description: name of the storage pool being managed. Note that pool must be previously defined with xml.

infini_export_client.description: This module creates, deletes or modifys NFS client(s) for existing exports on Infinibox.

no_root_squash.description: Don't squash root user to anonymous. Will be set to "no" on creation if not specified explicitly.

name.description: Client IP or Range. Ranges can be defined as follows 192.168.0.1-192.168.0.254.

state.description:
Default: present

Creates/Modifies client when present and removes when absent.

client.description: Client IP or Range. Ranges can be defined as follows 192.168.0.1-192.168.0.254.

access_mode.description:
Default: RW

Read Write or Read Only Access.

netapp_e_amg_sync.description: Allows for the initialization, suspension and resumption of an asynchronous mirror group's synchronization for NetApp E-series storage arrays.

api_url.description: The url to the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.

api_password.description: The password to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.

name.description: The name of the async mirror group you wish to target

state.description:
The synchronization action you'd like to take.
If C(running) then it will begin syncing if there is no active sync or will resume a suspended sync. If there is already a sync in progress, it will return with an OK status.
If C(suspended) it will suspend any ongoing sync action, but return OK if there is no active sync or if the sync is already suspended

api_username.description: The username to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.

delete_recovery_point.description:
Indicates whether the failures point can be deleted on the secondary if necessary to achieve the synchronization.
If true, and if the amount of unsynchronized data exceeds the CoW repository capacity on the secondary for any member volume, the last failures point will be deleted and synchronization will continue.
If false, the synchronization will be suspended if the amount of unsynchronized data exceeds the CoW Repository capacity on the secondary and the failures point will be preserved.
NOTE: This only has impact for newly launched syncs.

validate_certs.description:
Default: True

Should https certificates be validated?

ssid.description: The ID of the storage array containing the AMG you wish to target

rabbitmq_parameter.description: Manage dynamic, cluster-wide parameters for RabbitMQ

node.description:
Default: rabbit

erlang node name of the rabbit we wish to configure

name.description: Name of the parameter being set

component.description: Name of the component of which the parameter is being set

value.description: Value of the parameter, as a JSON term

vhost.description:
Default: /

vhost to apply access privileges.

state.description:
Default: present

Specify if user is to be added or removed

logentries.description: Sends logs to LogEntries in realtime

path.description: path to a log file

state.description:
Default: present

following state of the log

name.description: name of the log

openwrt_init.description: Controls OpenWrt services on remote hosts.

pattern.description: If the service does not respond to the 'running' command, name a substring to look for as would be found in the output of the I(ps) command as a stand-in for a 'running' result.  If the string is found, the service will be assumed to be running.

state.description: C(started)/C(stopped) are idempotent actions that will not run commands unless necessary. C(restarted) will always bounce the service. C(reloaded) will always reload.

enabled.description: Whether the service should start on boot. B(At least one of state and enabled are required.)

name.description: Name of the service.

smartos_image_facts.description: Retrieve facts about all installed images on SmartOS. Facts will be inserted to the ansible_facts key.

Criteria for selecting image. Can be any value from image manifest and 'published_date', 'published', 'source', 'clones', and 'size'. More informaton can be found at U(https://smartos.org/man/1m/imgadm) under 'imgadm list'.

bigip_pool_member.description: Manages F5 BIG-IP LTM pool members via iControl SOAP API

session_state.description: Set new session availability status for pool member

ratio.description: Pool member ratio weight. Valid values range from 1 through 100. New pool members -- unless overriden with this value -- default to 1.

description.description: Pool member description

monitor_state.description: Set monitor availability status for pool member

connection_limit.description: Pool member connection limit. Setting this to 0 disables the limit.

state.description:
Default: present

Pool member state

preserve_node.description:
Default: no

When state is absent and the pool member is no longer referenced in other pools, the default behavior removes the unused node o bject. Setting this to 'yes' disables this behavior.

Default: pong

Alternate data to return instead of 'pong'

avi_api_session.description:
This module can be used for calling any resources defined in Avi REST API. U(https://avinetworks.com/)
This module is useful for invoking HTTP Patch methods and accessing resources that do not have an REST object associated with them.

params.description: Query parameters passed to the HTTP API.

http_method.description: Allowed HTTP methods for RESTful services and are supported by Avi Controller.

data.description: HTTP body in YAML or JSON format.

timeout.description: Timeout (in seconds) for Avi API calls.

path.description: Path for Avi API resource. For example, C(path: virtualservice) will translate to C(api/virtualserivce).

ovirt_disks.description: Module to manage Virtual Machine and floating disks in oVirt.

vm_name.description: Name of the Virtual Machine to manage. Either C(vm_id) or C(vm_name) is required if C(state) is I(attached) or I(detached).

profile.description: Disk profile name to be attached to disk. By default profile is chosen by oVirt engine.

storage_domain.description: Storage domain name where disk should be created. By default storage is chosen by oVirt engine.

name.description: Name of the disk to manage. Either C(id) or C(name)/C(alias) is required.

format.description: Format of the disk. Either copy-on-write or raw.

bootable.description: I(True) if the disk should be bootable. By default when disk is created it isn't bootable.

logical_unit.description:
Dictionary which describes LUN to be directly attached to VM:
C(address) - Address of the storage server. Used by iSCSI.
C(port) - Port of the storage server. Used by iSCSI.
C(target) - iSCSI target.
C(lun_id) - LUN id.
C(username) - CHAP Username to be used to access storage server. Used by iSCSI.
C(password) - CHAP Password of the user to be used to access storage server. Used by iSCSI.
C(storage_type) - Storage type either I(fcp) or I(iscsi).

alias.description: Name of the disk to manage. Either C(id) or C(name)/C(alias) is required.

state.description:
Default: present

Should the Virtual Machine disk be present/absent/attached/detached.

shareable.description: I(True) if the disk should be shareable. By default when disk is created it isn't shareable.

interface.description:
Default: virtio

Driver of the storage interface.

vm_id.description: ID of the Virtual Machine to manage. Either C(vm_id) or C(vm_name) is required if C(state) is I(attached) or I(detached).

id.description: ID of the disk to manage. Either C(id) or C(name) is required.

size.description: Size of the disk. Size should be specified using IEC standard units. For example 10GiB, 1024MiB, etc.

nginx_status_facts.description: Gathers facts from nginx from an URL having C(stub_status) enabled.

url.description: URL of the nginx status.

timeout.description:
Default: 10

HTTP connection timeout in seconds.

state.description:
Default: present

state of the package

update_cache.description:
Default: no

update the package db first

name.description: name of package to install/remove

win_feature.description: Installs or uninstalls Windows Roles or Features on Windows Server. This module uses the Add/Remove-WindowsFeature Cmdlets on Windows 2008 and Install/Uninstall-WindowsFeature Cmdlets on Windows 2012, which are not available on client os machines.

name.description: Names of roles or features to install as a single feature or a comma-separated list of features

include_management_tools.description:
Adds the corresponding management tools to the specified feature.
Not supported in Windows 2008. If present when using Windows 2008 this option will be ignored.

include_sub_features.description: Adds all subfeatures of the specified feature

source.description:
Specify a source to install the feature from.
Not supported in Windows 2008. If present when using Windows 2008 this option will be ignored.

state.description:
Default: present

State of the features or roles on the system

restart.description: Restarts the computer automatically when installation is complete, if restarting is required by the roles or features installed.

win_psexec.description:
Run commands (remotely) through the PsExec service
Run commands as another (domain) user (with elevated privileges)

username.description:
The (remote) user to run the command as.
If not provided, the current user is used.

limited.description: Run the command as limited user (strips the Administrators group and allows only privileges assigned to the Users group).

executable.description:
Default: psexec.exe

The location of the PsExec utility (in case it is not located in your PATH).

chdir.description: Run the command from this (remote) directory.

noprofile.description: Run the command without loading the account's profile.

system.description: Run the remote command in the System account.

elevated.description: Run the command with elevated privileges.

priority.description: Used to run the command at a different priority.

hostnames.description:
The hostnames to run the command.
If not provided, the command is run locally.

command.description: The command line to run through PsExec (limited to 260 characters).

timeout.description: The connection timeout in seconds

wait.description:
Default: True

Wait for the application to terminate.
Only use for non-interactive applications.

password.description:
The password for the (remote) user to run the command as.
This is mandatory in order authenticate yourself.

interactive.description: Run the program so that it interacts with the desktop on the remote system.

username.description:
The username to set the service to start as.
This and the C(password) argument must be supplied together.

display_name.description: The display name to set for the service.

description.description: The description to set for the service.

force_dependent_services.description:
If True, stopping or restarting a service with dependent services will force the dependent services to stop or restart also.
If False, stopping or restarting a service with dependent services may fail.

dependency_action.description:
Default: set

Used in conjunction with C(dependency) to either add the dependencies to the existing service dependencies.
Remove the dependencies to the existing dependencies.
Set the dependencies to only the values in the list replacing the existing dependencies.

name.description: Name of the service

start_mode.description:
Set the startup type for the service.
C(delayed) added in Ansible 2.3

state.description:
C(started)/C(stopped)/C(absent) are idempotent actions that will not run commands unless necessary.
C(restarted) will always bounce the service.
C(absent) added in Ansible 2.3

dependencies.description:
A list of service dependencies to set for this particular service.
This should be a list of service names and not the display name of the service.
This works by C(dependency_action) to either add/remove or set the services in this list.

path.description: The path to the executable to set for the service.

password.description:
The password to set the service to start as.
This and the C(username) argument must be supplied together.
If specifying LocalSystem, NetworkService or LocalService this field must be an empty string and not null.

desktop_interact.description:
Whether to allow the service user to interact with the desktop.
This should only be set to true when using the LocalSystem username.

ec2_elb.description:
This module de-registers or registers an AWS EC2 instance from the ELBs that it belongs to.
Returns fact "ec2_elbs" which is a list of elbs attached to the instance if state=absent is passed as an argument.
Will be marked changed when called only if there are ELBs found to operate on.

state.description: register or deregister the instance

wait_timeout.description: Number of seconds to wait for an instance to change state. If 0 then this module may return an error if a transient error occurs. If non-zero then any transient errors are ignored until the timeout is reached. Ignored when wait=no.

ec2_elbs.description:
Default: None

List of ELB names, required for registration. The ec2_elbs fact should be used if there was a previous de-register.

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

When set to "no", SSL certificates will not be validated for boto versions >= 2.6.0.

enable_availability_zone.description:
Default: True

Whether to enable the availability zone of the instance on the target ELB if the availability zone has not already been enabled. If set to no, the task will fail if the availability zone is not enabled on the ELB.

wait.description:
Default: True

Wait for instance registration or deregistration to complete successfully before returning.

path.description:
Default: %TEMP%

Location where temporary file or directory should be created.
If path is not specified default system temporary directory (%TEMP%) will be used.

state.description:
Default: file

Whether to create file or directory.

prefix.description:
Default: ansible.

Prefix of file/directory name created by module.

suffix.description: Suffix of file/directory name created by module.

git_config.description: The M(git_config) module changes git configuration by invoking 'git config'. This is needed if you don't want to use M(template) for the entire git config file (e.g. because you need to change just C(user.email) in /etc/.git/config).  Solutions involving M(command) are cumbersone or don't work correctly in check mode.

repo.description: Path to a git repository for reading and writing values from a specific repo.

scope.description: Specify which scope to read/set values from. This is required when setting config values. If this is set to local, you must also specify the repo parameter. It defaults to system only when not using I(list_all)=yes.

list_all.description: List all settings (optionally limited to a given I(scope))

name.description: The name of the setting. If no value is supplied, the value will be read from the config if it has been set.

value.description: When specifying the name of a single setting, supply a value to set that setting to the given value.

Indicate desired state of the resource

cs_portforward.description: Create, update and remove port forwarding rules.

Protocol of the port forwarding rule.

Whether the firewall rule for public port should be created, while creating the new rule.
Use M(cs_firewall) for managing firewall rules.

public_port.description: Start public port for this rule.

Name of virtual machine which we make the port forwarding rule for.
Required if C(state=present).

public_end_port.description:

If not specified equal C(public_port).

policy_document.description: The path to the properly json formatted policy file (mutually exclusive with C(policy_json))

By default the module looks for any policies that match the document you pass in, if there is a match it will not make a new policy object with the same rules. You can override this by specifying false which would allow for two policy objects with different names but same rules.

This timeout is evaluated separately for both network appearance and test command success (so maximum clock time is actually twice this value)

rax_files_objects.description: Upload, download, and delete objects in Rackspace Cloud Files

src.description: Source from which to upload files.  Used to specify a remote object as a source for an operation, i.e. a file name, "file1", or a comma-separated list of remote objects, "file1,file2,file17".  src and dest are mutually exclusive on remote-only object operations

container.description: The container to use for file object operations.

dest.description: The destination of a "get" operation; i.e. a local directory, "/home/user/myfolder". Used to specify the destination of an operation on a remote object; i.e. a file name, "file1", or a comma-separated list of remote objects, "file1,file2,file17"

expires.description: Used to set an expiration on a file or folder uploaded to Cloud Files. Requires an integer, specifying expiration in seconds

Indicate desired state of the resource

Default: file

Metadata object or a file object

Default: get

The method of operation to be performed.  For example, put to upload files to Cloud Files, get to download files from Cloud Files or delete to delete remote objects in Cloud Files

structure.description:
Default: yes

Used to specify whether to maintain nested directory structure when downloading objects from Cloud Files.  Setting to false downloads the contents of a container to a single, flat directory

jenkins_plugin.description: Ansible module which helps to manage Jenkins plugins.

jenkins_home.description:
Default: /var/lib/jenkins

Home directory of the Jenkins user.

group.description:
Default: jenkins

Name of the Jenkins group on the OS.

name.description: Plugin name.

url.description:
Default: http://localhost:8080

URL of the Jenkins server.

updates_url.description:
Default: https://updates.jenkins-ci.org

URL of the Update Centre.
Used as the base URL to download the plugins and the I(update-center.json) JSON file.

with_dependencies.description:
Default: yes

Defines whether to install plugin dependencies.
This option takes effect only if the I(version) is not defined.

state.description:
Default: present

Desired plugin state.
If the C(latest) is set, the check for new version will be performed every time. This is suitable to keep the plugin up-to-date.

version.description:
Plugin version number.
If this option is specified, all plugin dependencies must be installed manually.
It might take longer to verify that the correct version is installed. This is especially true if a specific version number is specified.
Quote the version to prevent the value to be interpreted as float. For example if C(1.20) would be unquoted, it would become C(1.2).

params.description:
Option used to allow the user to overwrite any of the other options. To remove an option, set the value of the option to C(null).
Changed in 2.5.0, 2.4.1, 2.3.3 to raise an error if C(url_password) is specified in params. Use the actual C(url_password) argument instead.

mode.description:
Default: 0664

File mode applied on versioned plugins.

timeout.description:
Default: 30

Server connection timeout in secs.

owner.description:
Default: jenkins

Name of the Jenkins user on the OS.

updates_expiration.description:
Default: 86400

Number of seconds after which a new copy of the I(update-center.json) file is downloaded. This is used to avoid the need to download the plugin to calculate its checksum when C(latest) is specified.
Set it to C(0) if no cache file should be used. In that case, the plugin file will always be downloaded to calculate its checksum when C(latest) is specified.

cnos_portchannel.description: This module allows you to work with port aggregation related configurations. The operators used are overloaded to ensure control over switch port aggregation configurations. Apart from the regular device connection related attributes, there are five LAG arguments which are overloaded variables that will perform further configurations. They are interfaceArg1, interfaceArg2, interfaceArg3, interfaceArg4, and interfaceArg5. For more details on how to use these arguments, see [Overloaded Variables]. This module uses SSH to manage network device configuration. The results of the operation will be placed in a directory named 'results' that must be created by the user in their local directory to where the playbook is run. For more information about this module from Lenovo and customizing it usage for your use cases, please U(http://systemx.lenovofiles.com/help/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.lenovo.switchmgt.ansible.doc%2Fcnos_portchannel.html)

interfaceRange.description: This specifies the interface range in which the port aggregation is envisaged

interfaceArg4.description: This is an overloaded Port Channel fourth argument. Usage of this argument can be found is the User Guide referenced above.

interfaceArg5.description: This is an overloaded Port Channel fifth argument. Usage of this argument can be found is the User Guide referenced above.

interfaceArg6.description: This is an overloaded Port Channel sixth argument. Usage of this argument can be found is the User Guide referenced above.

interfaceArg7.description: This is an overloaded Port Channel seventh argument. Usage of this argument can be found is the User Guide referenced above.

interfaceArg1.description: This is an overloaded Port Channel first argument. Usage of this argument can be found is the User Guide referenced above.

interfaceArg2.description: This is an overloaded Port Channel second argument. Usage of this argument can be found is the User Guide referenced above.

interfaceArg3.description: This is an overloaded Port Channel third argument. Usage of this argument can be found is the User Guide referenced above.

cnos_rollback.description: This module allows you to work with switch configurations. It provides a way to roll back configurations of a switch from a remote server. This is achieved by using startup or running configurations of the target device that were previously backed up to a remote server using FTP, SFTP, TFTP, or SCP. The first step is to create a directory from where the remote server can be reached. The next step is to provide the full file path of the backup configurations location. Authentication details required by the remote server must be provided as well. By default, this method overwrites the switchs configuration file with the newly downloaded file. This module uses SSH to manage network device configuration. The results of the operation will be placed in a directory named 'results' that must be created by the user in their local directory to where the playbook is run. For more information about this module from Lenovo and customizing it usage for your use cases, please visit U(http://systemx.lenovofiles.com/help/index.jsp?topic=%2Fcom.lenovo.switchmgt.ansible.doc%2Fcnos_rollback.html)

serverpassword.description: Specify the password for the server relating to the protocol used.

protocol.description: This refers to the protocol used by the network device to interact with the remote server from where to download the backup configuration. The choices are FTP, SFTP, TFTP, or SCP. Any other protocols will result in error. If this parameter is not specified, there is no default value to be used.

configType.description: This refers to the type of configuration which will be used for the rolling back process. The choices are the running or startup configurations. There is no default value, so it will result in an error if the input is incorrect.

serverusername.description: Specify the username for the server relating to the protocol used.

rcserverip.description: This specifies the IP Address of the remote server from where the backup configuration will be downloaded.

rcpath.description: This specifies the full file path of the configuration file located on the remote server. In case the relative path is used as the variable value, the root folder for the user of the server needs to be specified.

name.description: Group name

Group description

consul_session.description: allows the addition, modification and deletion of sessions in a consul cluster. These sessions can then be used in conjunction with key value pairs to implement distributed locks. In depth documentation for working with sessions can be found here http://www.consul.io/docs/internals/sessions.html

node.description:
Default: None

the name of the node that with which the session will be associated. by default this is the name of the agent.

datacenter.description:
Default: None

name of the datacenter in which the session exists or should be created.

name.description:
Default: None

the name that should be associated with the session. This is opaque to Consul and not required.

host.description:
Default: localhost

host of the consul agent defaults to localhost

port.description:
Default: 8500

the port on which the consul agent is running

delay.description:
Default: 15

the optional lock delay that can be attached to the session when it is created. Locks for invalidated sessions ar blocked from being acquired until this delay has expired. Durations are in seconds

state.description:
Default: present

whether the session should be present i.e. created if it doesn't exist, or absent, removed if present. If created, the ID for the session is returned in the output. If absent, the name or ID is required to remove the session. Info for a single session, all the sessions for a node or all available sessions can be retrieved by specifying info, node or list for the state; for node or info, the node name or session id is required as parameter.

behavior.description:
Default: release

the optional behavior that can be attached to the session when it is created. This can be set to either release or delete. This controls the behavior when a session is invalidated.

scheme.description:
Default: http

the protocol scheme on which the consul agent is running

validate_certs.description:
Default: True

whether to verify the tls certificate of the consul agent

checks.description:
Default: None

a list of checks that will be used to verify the session health. If all the checks fail, the session will be invalidated and any locks associated with the session will be release and can be acquired once the associated lock delay has expired.

ec2_group_facts.description: Gather facts about ec2 security groups in AWS.

filters.description: A dict of filters to apply. Each dict item consists of a filter key and a filter value. See       U(https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_DescribeSecurityGroups.html) for       possible filters. Filter names and values are case sensitive. You can also use underscores (_)       instead of dashes (-) in the filter keys, which will take precedence in case of conflict.

parted.description: This module allows configuring block device partition using the C(parted) command line tool. For a full description of the fields and the options check the GNU parted manual.

part_start.description:
Default: 0%

Where the partition will start as offset from the beginning of the disk, that is, the "distance" from the start of the disk. The distance can be specified with all the units supported by parted (except compat) and it is case sensitive. E.g. C(10GiB), C(15%).

part_end.description:
Default: 100%

Where the partition will end as offset from the beginning of the disk, that is, the "distance" from the start of the disk. The distance can be specified with all the units supported by parted (except compat) and it is case sensitive. E.g. C(10GiB), C(15%).

name.description: Sets the name for the partition number (GPT, Mac, MIPS and PC98 only).

align.description:
Default: optimal

Set alignment for newly created partitions.

number.description: The number of the partition to work with or the number of the partition that will be created. Required when performing any action on the disk, except fetching information.

label.description:
Default: msdos

Creates a new disk label.

state.description:
Default: info

If to create or delete a partition. If set to C(info) the module will only return the device information.

part_type.description: Is one of 'primary', 'extended' or 'logical' and may be specified only with 'msdos' or 'dvh' partition tables. A name must be specified for a 'gpt' partition table. Neither part-type nor name may be used with a 'sun' partition table.

flags.description: A list of the flags that has to be set on the partition.

device.description: The block device (disk) where to operate.

unit.description:
Default: KiB

Selects the current default unit that Parted will use to display locations and capacities on the disk and to interpret those given by the user if they are not suffixed by an unit. When fetching information about a disk, it is always recommended to specify a unit.

ec2_win_password.description: Gets the default administrator password from any EC2 Windows instance.  The instance is referenced by its id (e.g. i-XXXXXXX). This module has a dependency on python-boto.

instance_id.description: The instance id to get the password data from.

key_file.description: Path to the file containing the key pair used on the instance.

wait_timeout.description:
Default: 120

Number of seconds to wait before giving up.

key_passphrase.description: The passphrase for the instance key pair. The key must use DES or 3DES encryption for this module to decrypt it. You can use openssl to convert your password protected keys if they do not use DES or 3DES. ex) openssl rsa -in current_key -out new_key -des3.

wait.description:
Default: no

Whether or not to wait for the password to be available before returning.

local_admin_password.description: password to be assigned to the local C(Administrator) user (required when C(state) is C(member_server))

vsan_mode.description: Specify which VSAN compliant mode to enter

Whether the job should be enabled or disabled.

token.description: API token used to authenticate alternatively to password.

Default: True

Should https certificates be validated?

array_wwn.description: The WWN of the array to manage. Only necessary if in-band managing multiple arrays on the same agent host.  Mutually exclusive of controller_addresses parameter.

api_password.description: The password to authenticate with the SANtricity WebServices Proxy or embedded REST API.

cron.description:
Use this module to manage crontab and environment variables entries. This module allows you to create environment variables and named crontab entries, update, or delete them.
When crontab jobs are managed: the module includes one line with the description of the crontab entry C("#Ansible: <name>") corresponding to the "name" passed to the module, which is used by future ansible/module calls to find/check the state. The "name" parameter should be unique, and changing the "name" value will result in a new cron task being created (or a different one being removed).
When environment variables are managed: no comment line is added, but, when the module needs to find/check the state, it uses the "name" parameter to find the environment variable definition line.
When using symbols such as %, they must be properly escaped.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether to ensure the job or environment variable is present or absent.

name.description: Description of a crontab entry or, if env is set, the name of environment variable. Required if state=absent. Note that if name is not set and state=present, then a new crontab entry will always be created, regardless of existing ones.

insertbefore.description: Used with C(state=present) and C(env). If specified, the environment variable will be inserted before the declaration of specified environment variable.

dom.description:
Default: *

Day of the month the job should run ( 1-31, *, */2, etc )

hour.description:
Default: *

Hour when the job should run ( 0-23, *, */2, etc )

dow.description:
Default: *

Day of the week that the job should run ( 0-6 for Sunday-Saturday, *, etc )

cron_file.description: If specified, uses this file instead of an individual user's crontab. If this is a relative path, it is interpreted with respect to /etc/cron.d. (If it is absolute, it will typically be /etc/crontab). To use the C(cron_file) parameter you must specify the C(user) as well.

reboot.description:
Default: no

If the job should be run at reboot. This option is deprecated. Users should use special_time.

value.description: The command to execute or, if env is set, the value of environment variable. Required if state=present.

month.description:
Default: *

Month of the year the job should run ( 1-12, *, */2, etc )

disabled.description: If the job should be disabled (commented out) in the crontab. Only has effect if state=present

job.description: The command to execute or, if env is set, the value of environment variable. Required if state=present.

user.description:
Default: root

The specific user whose crontab should be modified.

env.description:
Default: no

If set, manages a crontab's environment variable. New variables are added on top of crontab. "name" and "value" parameters are the name and the value of environment variable.

insertafter.description: Used with C(state=present) and C(env). If specified, the environment variable will be inserted after the declaration of specified environment variable.

backup.description: If set, create a backup of the crontab before it is modified. The location of the backup is returned in the C(backup_file) variable by this module.

day.description:
Default: *

Day of the month the job should run ( 1-31, *, */2, etc )

minute.description:
Default: *

Minute when the job should run ( 0-59, *, */2, etc )

weekday.description:
Default: *

Day of the week that the job should run ( 0-6 for Sunday-Saturday, *, etc )

lvol.description: This module creates, removes or resizes logical volumes.

pvs.description: Comma separated list of physical volumes e.g. /dev/sda,/dev/sdb

force.description:
Default: no

Shrink or remove operations of volumes requires this switch. Ensures that that filesystems get never corrupted/destroyed by mistake.

vg.description: The volume group this logical volume is part of.

lv.description: The name of the logical volume.

state.description:
Default: present

Control if the logical volume exists. If C(present) and the volume does not already exist then the C(size) option is required.

snapshot.description: The name of the snapshot volume

active.description:
Default: yes

Whether the volume is activate and visible to the host.

shrink.description:
Default: True

shrink if current size is higher than size requested

opts.description: Free-form options to be passed to the lvcreate command

size.description: The size of the logical volume, according to lvcreate(8) --size, by default in megabytes or optionally with one of [bBsSkKmMgGtTpPeE] units; or according to lvcreate(8) --extents as a percentage of [VG|PVS|FREE]; Float values must begin with a digit. Resizing using percentage values was not supported prior to 2.1.

ios_facts.description: Collects a base set of device facts from a remote device that is running IOS.  This module prepends all of the base network fact keys with C(ansible_net_<fact>).  The facts module will always collect a base set of facts from the device and can enable or disable collection of additional facts.

gather_subset.description:
Default: !config

When supplied, this argument will restrict the facts collected to a given subset.  Possible values for this argument include all, hardware, config, and interfaces.  Can specify a list of values to include a larger subset.  Values can also be used with an initial C(M(!)) to specify that a specific subset should not be collected.

s3_website.description: Configure an s3 bucket as a website

redirect_all_requests.description: Describes the redirect behavior for every request to this s3 bucket website endpoint

suffix.description:
Default: index.html

Suffix that is appended to a request that is for a directory on the website endpoint (e.g. if the suffix is index.html and you make a request to samplebucket/images/ the data that is returned will be for the object with the key name images/index.html). The suffix must not include a slash character.

region.description: AWS region to create the bucket in. If not set then the value of the AWS_REGION and EC2_REGION environment variables are checked, followed by the aws_region and ec2_region settings in the Boto config file.  If none of those are set the region defaults to the S3 Location: US Standard.

error_key.description: The object key name to use when a 4XX class error occurs. To remove an error key, set to None.

state.description:
Default: present

Add or remove s3 website configuration

name.description: Name of the s3 bucket

revision.description: A hash, number, tag, or other identifier showing what revision was deployed

droplet_id.description: The droplet id you want to operate on. Required when command=attach.

description.description: Description of the Block Storage volume.

native_vlan.description: If C(mode=trunk), used as the trunk native VLAN ID.

access_vlan.description: If C(mode=access), used as the access VLAN ID.

trunk_add_vlans.description: If C(mode=trunk), used as the VLAN range to ADD or REMOVE from the trunk.

A list of files to extract from the image.

ec2_vpc.description: Create or terminates AWS virtual private clouds.  This module has a dependency on python-boto.

subnets.description:
A dictionary array of subnets to add of the form C({ cidr: ..., az: ... , resource_tags: ... }).
Where C(az) is the desired availability zone of the subnet, optional.
Tags C(resource_tags) use dictionary form C({ "Environment":"Dev", "Tier":"Web", ...}), optional.
C(resource_tags) see resource_tags for VPC below. The main difference is subnet tags not specified here will be deleted.
All VPC subnets not in this list will be removed as well.
As of 1.8, if the subnets parameter is not specified, no existing subnets will be modified.'

route_tables.description: A dictionary array of route tables to add of the form: C({ subnets: [172.22.2.0/24, 172.22.3.0/24,], routes: [{ dest: 0.0.0.0/0, gw: igw},], resource_tags: ... }). Where the subnets list is those subnets the route table should be associated with, and the routes list is a list of routes to be in the table.  The special keyword for the gw of igw specifies that you should the route should go through the internet gateway attached to the VPC. gw also accepts instance-ids, interface-ids, and vpc-peering-connection-ids in addition igw. resource_tags is optional and uses dictionary form: C({ "Name": "public", ... }). This module is currently unable to affect the "main" route table due to some limitations in boto, so you must explicitly define the associated subnets or they will be attached to the main table implicitly. As of 1.8, if the route_tables parameter is not specified, no existing routes will be modified.

dns_support.description:
Default: yes

Toggles the "Enable DNS resolution" flag.

internet_gateway.description:
Default: no

Toggle whether there should be an Internet gateway attached to the VPC.

instance_tenancy.description:
Default: default

The supported tenancy options for instances launched into the VPC.

state.description: Create or terminate the VPC.

wait_timeout.description:
Default: 300

How long before wait gives up, in seconds.

dns_hostnames.description:
Default: yes

Toggles the "Enable DNS hostname support for instances" flag.

resource_tags.description: A dictionary array of resource tags of the form C({ tag1: value1, tag2: value2 }). - Tags in this list are used in conjunction with CIDR block to uniquely identify a VPC in lieu of vpc_id. Therefore, if CIDR/Tag combination does not exist, a new VPC will be created.  VPC tags not on this list will be ignored. Prior to 1.7, specifying a resource tag was optional.

vpc_id.description: A VPC id to terminate when I(state=absent).

cidr_block.description: The cidr block representing the VPC, e.g. C(10.0.0.0/16), required when I(state=present).

wait.description:
Default: no

Wait for the VPC to be in state 'available' before returning.

deploy_path.description:

state.description:
