key_options.description: A string of ssh key options to be prepended to the key in the authorized_keys file

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the given key (with the given key_options) should or should not be in the file

user.description: The username on the remote host whose authorized_keys file will be modified

key.description: The SSH public key(s), as a string or (since 1.9) url (https://github.com/username.keys)

path.description:
Default: (homedir)+/.ssh/authorized_keys

Alternate path to the authorized_keys file

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

This only applies if using a https url as the source of the keys. If set to C(no), the SSL certificates will not be validated.
This should only set to C(no) used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates as it avoids verifying the source site.
Prior to 2.1 the code worked as if this was set to C(yes).

manage_dir.description:
Default: yes

Whether this module should manage the directory of the authorized key file.  If set, the module will create the directory, as well as set the owner and permissions of an existing directory. Be sure to set C(manage_dir=no) if you are using an alternate directory for authorized_keys, as set with C(path), since you could lock yourself out of SSH access. See the example below.

vmware_guest_facts.description: Gather facts about a single Virtual Machine on a VMware ESX cluster

datacenter.description: Destination datacenter for the deploy operation

folder.description:
Default: /vm

Destination folder, absolute or relative path to find an existing guest.
This is required if name is supplied.
The folder should include the datacenter. ESX's datacenter is ha-datacenter
Examples:
   folder: /ha-datacenter/vm
   folder: ha-datacenter/vm
   folder: /datacenter1/vm
   folder: datacenter1/vm
   folder: /datacenter1/vm/folder1
   folder: datacenter1/vm/folder1
   folder: /folder1/datacenter1/vm
   folder: folder1/datacenter1/vm
   folder: /folder1/datacenter1/vm/folder2
   folder: vm/folder2
   folder: folder2

uuid.description:
UUID of the instance to manage if known, this is VMware's unique identifier.
This is required if name is not supplied.

name.description: Name of the Virtual Machine to work with

name_match.description:
Default: first

If multiple Virtual Machines matching the name, use the first or last found

openssl_publickey.description: This module allows one to (re)generate OpenSSL public keys from their private keys. It uses the pyOpenSSL python library to interact with openssl. Keys are generated in PEM format. This module works only if the version of PyOpenSSL is recent enough (> 16.0.0)

path.description: Name of the file in which the generated TLS/SSL public key will be written.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the public key should exist or not, taking action if the state is different from what is stated.

force.description: Should the key be regenerated even it it already exists

privatekey_path.description: Path to the TLS/SSL private key from which to genereate the public key.

change_hostname_to.description: The hostname that an ESXi host should be changed to.

dns_servers.description: The DNS servers that the host should be configured to use.

domainname.description: The domain the ESXi host should be apart of.

nxos_ospf_vrf.description: Manages a VRF for an OSPF router.

router_id.description: Router Identifier (ID) of the OSPF router VRF instance.

timer_throttle_lsa_max.description: Specify the max interval for rate-limiting Link-State Advertisement (LSA) generation. Valid values are an integer, in milliseconds, or the keyword 'default'.

timer_throttle_spf_max.description: Specify the maximum wait time between Shortest Path First (SPF) calculations. Valid values are an integer, in milliseconds, or the keyword 'default'.

timer_throttle_lsa_hold.description: Specify the hold interval for rate-limiting Link-State Advertisement (LSA) generation. Valid values are an integer, in milliseconds, or the keyword 'default'.

default_metric.description: Specify the default Metric value. Valid values are an integer or the keyword 'default'.

log_adjacency.description: Controls the level of log messages generated whenever a neighbor changes state. Valid values are 'log', 'detail', and 'default'.

timer_throttle_lsa_start.description: Specify the start interval for rate-limiting Link-State Advertisement (LSA) generation. Valid values are an integer, in milliseconds, or the keyword 'default'.

vrf.description:
Default: default

Name of the resource instance. Valid value is a string. The name 'default' is a valid VRF representing the global OSPF.

auto_cost.description: Specifies the reference bandwidth used to assign OSPF cost. Valid values are an integer, in Mbps, or the keyword 'default'.

timer_throttle_spf_start.description: Specify initial Shortest Path First (SPF) schedule delay. Valid values are an integer, in milliseconds, or the keyword 'default'.

timer_throttle_spf_hold.description: Specify minimum hold time between Shortest Path First (SPF) calculations. Valid values are an integer, in milliseconds, or the keyword 'default'.

packet_device.description:
create, destroy, update, start, stop, and reboot a Packet Host machine. When the machine is created it can optionally wait for it to have an IP address before returning. This module has a dependency on packet >= 1.0.
API is documented at U(https://www.packet.net/help/api/#page:devices,header:devices-devices-post).

count.description: The number of devices to create. Count number can be included in hostname via the %d string formatter.

operating_system.description: OS slug for device creation. See Packet docs or API for current list.

features.description: Dict with "features" for device creation. See Packet API docs for details.

facility.description: Facility slug for device creation. As of 2016, it should be one of [ewr1, sjc1, ams1, nrt1].

lock.description: Whether to lock a created device.

auth_token.description: Packet api token. You can also supply it in env var C(PACKET_API_TOKEN).

count_offset.description: From which number to start the count.

wait.description: Whether to wait for the instance to be assigned IP address before returning.

user_data.description:
Default: None

Userdata blob made available to the machine

project_id.description: ID of project of the device.

state.description:
Default: present

Desired state of the device.

hostnames.description:
A hostname of a device, or a list of hostnames.
If given string or one-item list, you can use the C("%d") Python string format to expand numbers from count.
If only one hostname, it might be expanded to list if count>1.

plan.description: Plan slug for device creation. See Packet docs or API for current list.

device_ids.description: List of device IDs on which to operate.

wait_timeout.description:
Default: 60

How long to wait for IP address of new devices before quitting. In seconds.

name.description:
A hostname of a device, or a list of hostnames.
If given string or one-item list, you can use the C("%d") Python string format to expand numbers from count.
If only one hostname, it might be expanded to list if count>1.

cl_bridge.description: Configures a bridge interface on Cumulus Linux To configure a bond port use the cl_bond module. To configure any other type of interface use the cl_interface module. Follow the guidelines for bridging found in the Cumulus User Guide at U(http://docs.cumulusnetworks.com)

addr_method.description: Configures the port to use DHCP. To enable this feature use the option I(dhcp).

name.description: Name of the interface.

mstpctl_treeprio.description: Set spanning tree root priority. Must be a multiple of 4096.

virtual_mac.description: Define Ethernet mac associated with Cumulus Linux VRR feature.

mtu.description: Set MTU. Configure Jumbo Frame by setting MTU to I(9000).

pvid.description: In vlan-aware mode, defines vlan that is the untagged vlan.

ipv4.description: List of IPv4 addresses to configure on the interface. In the form I(X.X.X.X/YY).

stp.description:
Default: yes

Enables spanning tree Protocol. As of Cumulus Linux 2.5 the default bridging mode, only per vlan RSTP or 802.1d is supported. For the vlan aware mode, only common instance STP is supported

virtual_ip.description: Define IPv4 virtual IP used by the Cumulus Linux VRR feature.

ipv6.description: List of IPv6 addresses to configure on the interface. In the form I(X:X:X::X/YYY).

vids.description: In vlan-aware mode, lists VLANs defined under the interface.

location.description:
Default: ['/etc/network/interfaces.d']

Interface directory location.

flowdock.description: Send a message to a flowdock team inbox or chat using the push API (see https://www.flowdock.com/api/team-inbox and https://www.flowdock.com/api/chat)

from_name.description: (inbox only) Name of the message sender

from_address.description: (inbox only - required) Email address of the message sender

tags.description: tags of the message, separated by commas

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

external_user_name.description: (chat only - required) Name of the "user" sending the message

project.description: (inbox only) Human readable identifier for more detailed message categorization

source.description: (inbox only - required) Human readable identifier of the application that uses the Flowdock API

token.description: API token.

link.description: (inbox only) Link associated with the message. This will be used to link the message subject in Team Inbox.

msg.description: Content of the message

type.description: Whether to post to 'inbox' or 'chat'

subject.description: (inbox only - required) Subject line of the message

bigip_routedomain.description: Manage route domains on a BIG-IP

flow_eviction_policy.description: The eviction policy to use with this route domain. Apply an eviction policy to provide customized responses to flow overflows and slow flows on the route domain.

service_policy.description: Service policy to associate with the route domain.

description.description: Specifies descriptive text that identifies the route domain.

parent.description:
Specifies the route domain the system searches when it cannot
find a route in the configured domain.

connection_limit.description: The maximum number of concurrent connections allowed for the route domain. Setting this to C(0) turns off connection limits.

strict.description: Specifies whether the system enforces cross-routing restrictions or not.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the route domain should exist or not.

routing_protocol.description: Dynamic routing protocols for the system to use in the route domain.

bwc_policy.description: The bandwidth controller for the route domain.

vlans.description: VLANs for the system to use in the route domain

id.description: The unique identifying integer representing the route domain.

locale_gen.description: Manages locales by editing /etc/locale.gen and invoking locale-gen.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the locale shall be present.

name.description: Name and encoding of the locale, such as "en_GB.UTF-8".

path.description:
Path of the domain.
Prefix C(ROOT/) or C(/ROOT/) in path is optional.

state.description:
Default: present

State of the domain.

network_domain.description: Network domain for networks in the domain.

poll_async.description:
Default: True

Poll async jobs until job has finished.

clean_up.description:
Clean up all domain resources like child domains and accounts.
Considered on C(state=absent).

win_msi.description: Installs or uninstalls a Windows MSI file that is already located on the target server

extra_args.description: Additional arguments to pass to the msiexec.exe command

path.description: File system path to the MSI file to install

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the MSI file should be installed or uninstalled

creates.description: Path to a file created by installing the MSI to prevent from attempting to reinstall the package on every run

wait.description: Specify whether to wait for install or uninstall to complete before continuing.

find.description: Return a list files based on specific criteria. Multiple criteria are AND'd together.

paths.description: List of paths to the file or directory to search. All paths must be fully qualified.

name.description: List of paths to the file or directory to search. All paths must be fully qualified.

file_type.description:
Default: file

Type of file to select

pattern.description:
Default: *

One or more (shell or regex) patterns, which type is controlled by C(use_regex) option.
The patterns restrict the list of files to be returned to those whose basenames match at least one of the patterns specified. Multiple patterns can be specified using a list.

age.description: Select files whose age is equal to or greater than the specified time. Use a negative age to find files equal to or less than the specified time. You can choose seconds, minutes, hours, days, or weeks by specifying the first letter of any of those words (e.g., "1w").

contains.description: One or more regex patterns which should be matched against the file content

recurse.description:
Default: no

If target is a directory, recursively descend into the directory looking for files.

age_stamp.description:
Default: mtime

Choose the file property against which we compare age. Default is mtime.

patterns.description:
Default: *

One or more (shell or regex) patterns, which type is controlled by C(use_regex) option.
The patterns restrict the list of files to be returned to those whose basenames match at least one of the patterns specified. Multiple patterns can be specified using a list.

get_checksum.description:
Default: False

Set this to true to retrieve a file's sha1 checksum

follow.description:
Default: False

Set this to true to follow symlinks in path for systems with python 2.6+

use_regex.description:
Default: False

If false the patterns are file globs (shell) if true they are python regexes

path.description: List of paths to the file or directory to search. All paths must be fully qualified.

hidden.description:
Default: False

Set this to true to include hidden files, otherwise they'll be ignored.

size.description: Select files whose size is equal to or greater than the specified size. Use a negative size to find files equal to or less than the specified size. Unqualified values are in bytes, but b, k, m, g, and t can be appended to specify bytes, kilobytes, megabytes, gigabytes, and terabytes, respectively. Size is not evaluated for directories.

rax_cdb_database.description: create / delete a database in the Cloud Databases.

state.description:
Default: present

Indicate desired state of the resource

character_set.description:
Default: utf8

Set of symbols and encodings

name.description: Name to give to the database

collate.description:
Default: utf8_general_ci

Set of rules for comparing characters in a character set

cronvar.description: Use this module to manage crontab variables. This module allows you to create, update, or delete cron variable definitions.

name.description: Name of the crontab variable.

insertbefore.description: Used with C(state=present). If specified, the variable will be inserted just before the variable specified.

cron_file.description: If specified, uses this file instead of an individual user's crontab. Without a leading /, this is assumed to be in /etc/cron.d.  With a leading /, this is taken as absolute.

value.description: The value to set this variable to.  Required if state=present.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether to ensure that the variable is present or absent.

user.description:
Default: root

The specific user whose crontab should be modified.

insertafter.description: Used with C(state=present). If specified, the variable will be inserted after the variable specified.

backup.description: If set, create a backup of the crontab before it is modified. The location of the backup is returned in the C(backup) variable by this module.

virt.description: Manages virtual machines supported by I(libvirt).

xml.description: XML document used with the define command

name.description: name of the guest VM being managed. Note that VM must be previously defined with xml.

state.description:
Default: no

Note that there may be some lag for state requests like C(shutdown) since these refer only to VM states. After starting a guest, it may not be immediately accessible.

command.description: in addition to state management, various non-idempotent commands are available. See examples

cloudwatchevent_rule.description: This module creates and manages CloudWatch event rules and targets.

role_arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role associated with the rule

description.description: A description of the rule

event_pattern.description: A string pattern (in valid JSON format) that is used to match against incoming events to determine if the rule should be triggered

schedule_expression.description: A cron or rate expression that defines the schedule the rule will trigger on. For example, C(cron(0 20 * * ? *)), C(rate(5 minutes))

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the rule is present (and enabled), disabled, or absent

targets.description: A dictionary array of targets to add to or update for the rule, in the form C({ id: [string], arn: [string], input: [valid JSON string], input_path: [valid JSONPath string] }). I(id) [required] is the unique target assignment ID. I(arn) (required) is the Amazon Resource Name associated with the target. I(input) (optional) is a JSON object that will override the event data when passed to the target.  I(input_path) (optional) is a JSONPath string (e.g. C($.detail)) that specifies the part of the event data to be passed to the target. If neither I(input) nor I(input_path) is specified, then the entire event is passed to the target in JSON form.

name.description: The name of the rule you are creating, updating or deleting. No spaces or special characters allowed (i.e. must match C([\.\-_A-Za-z0-9]+))

win_msg.description: Wraps the msg.exe command in order to send messages to Windows hosts.

msg.description:
Default: Hello world!

The text of the message to be displayed.

to.description:
Default: *

Who to send the message to. Can be a username, sessionname or sessionid.

wait.description: Whether to wait for users to respond.  Module will only wait for the number of seconds specified in display_seconds or 10 seconds if not specified. However, if I(wait) is true, the message is sent to each logged on user in turn, waiting for the user to either press 'ok' or for the timeout to elapse before moving on to the next user.

display_seconds.description:
Default: 10

How long to wait for receiver to acknowledge message, in seconds.

pagerduty_alert.description: This module will let you trigger, acknowledge or resolve a PagerDuty incident by sending events

client_url.description: The URL of the monitoring client that is triggering this event.

name.description: PagerDuty unique subdomain.

state.description: Type of event to be sent.

incident_key.description:
Identifies the incident to which this I(state) should be applied.
For C(triggered) I(state) - If there's no open (i.e. unresolved) incident with this key, a new one will be created. If there's already an open incident with a matching key, this event will be appended to that incident's log. The event key provides an easy way to "de-dup" problem reports.
For C(acknowledged) or C(resolved) I(state) - This should be the incident_key you received back when the incident was first opened by a trigger event. Acknowledge events referencing resolved or nonexistent incidents will be discarded.

client.description: The name of the monitoring client that is triggering this event.

service_key.description:
The GUID of one of your "Generic API" services.
This is the "service key" listed on a Generic API's service detail page.

api_key.description: The pagerduty API key (readonly access), generated on the pagerduty site.

desc.description:
Default: Created via Ansible

For C(triggered) I(state) - Required. Short description of the problem that led to this trigger. This field (or a truncated version) will be used when generating phone calls, SMS messages and alert emails. It will also appear on the incidents tables in the PagerDuty UI. The maximum length is 1024 characters.
For C(acknowledged) or C(resolved) I(state) - Text that will appear in the incident's log associated with this event.

github_key.description: Creates, removes, or updates GitHub access keys.

force.description:
Default: yes

The default is C(yes), which will replace the existing remote key if it's different than C(pubkey). If C(no), the key will only be set if no key with the given C(name) exists.

token.description: GitHub Access Token with permission to list and create public keys.

pubkey.description:
Default: none

SSH public key value. Required when C(state=present).

name.description: SSH key name

state.description:
Default: present

Whether to remove a key, ensure that it exists, or update its value.

cs_template.description: Register a template from URL, create a template from a ROOT volume of a stopped VM or its snapshot, extract and delete templates.

is_featured.description:
Register the template to be featured.
Only used if C(state) is present.

vm.description:
VM name the template will be created from its volume or alternatively from a snapshot.
VM must be in stopped state if created from its volume.
Mutually exclusive with C(url).

domain.description: Domain the template, snapshot or VM is related to.

is_extractable.description: True if the template or its derivatives are extractable.

poll_async.description:
Default: True

Poll async jobs until job has finished.

password_enabled.description: True if the template supports the password reset feature.

zone.description:
Name of the zone you wish the template to be registered or deleted from.
If not specified, first found zone will be used.

sshkey_enabled.description: True if the template supports the sshkey upload feature.

is_dynamically_scalable.description:
Register the template having XS/VMWare tools installed in order to support dynamic scaling of VM CPU/memory.
Only used if C(state) is present.

state.description:
Default: present

State of the template.

template_filter.description:
Default: self

Name of the filter used to search for the template.

is_ready.description:
This flag is used for searching existing templates.
If set to C(true), it will only list template ready for deployment e.g. successfully downloaded and installed.
Recommended to set it to C(false).

is_routing.description:
True if the template type is routing i.e., if template is used to deploy router.
Only considered if C(url) is used.

format.description:
The format for the template.
Relevant when using C(state=present).

is_public.description:
Register the template to be publicly available to all users.
Only used if C(state) is present.

requires_hvm.description: true if this template requires HVM.

account.description: Account the template, snapshot or VM is related to.

name.description: Name of the template.

url.description:
URL of where the template is hosted on C(state=present).
URL to which the template would be extracted on C(state=extracted).
Mutually exclusive with C(vm).

checksum.description:
The MD5 checksum value of this template.
If set, we search by checksum instead of name.

cross_zones.description:
Whether the template should be synced or removed across zones.
Only used if C(state) is present or absent.

project.description: Name of the project the template to be registered in.

snapshot.description:
Name of the snapshot, created from the VM ROOT volume, the template will be created from.
C(vm) is required together with this argument.

mode.description:
Default: http_download

Mode for the template extraction.
Only used if C(state=extracted).

hypervisor.description:
Name the hypervisor to be used for creating the new template.
Relevant when using C(state=present).

os_type.description: OS type that best represents the OS of this template.

profitbricks_volume_attachments.description: Allows you to attach or detach a volume from a ProfitBricks server. This module has a dependency on profitbricks >= 1.0.0

datacenter.description: The datacenter in which to operate.

subscription_user.description: The ProfitBricks username. Overrides the PB_SUBSCRIPTION_ID environment variable.

server.description: The name of the server you wish to detach or attach the volume.

state.description:
Default: present

Indicate desired state of the resource

wait_timeout.description:
Default: 600

how long before wait gives up, in seconds

subscription_password.description: THe ProfitBricks password. Overrides the PB_PASSWORD environment variable.

wait.description:
Default: yes

wait for the operation to complete before returning

os_auth.description: Retrieve an auth token from an OpenStack Cloud

aos_external_router.description: Apstra AOS External Router module let you manage your External Router easily. You can create create and delete External Router by Name, ID or by using a JSON File. This module is idempotent and support the I(check) mode. It's using the AOS REST API.

name.description: Name of the External Router to manage. Only one of I(name), I(id) or I(content) can be set.

loopback.description: IP address of the Loopback interface of the external_router.

id.description: AOS Id of the External Router to manage (can't be used to create a new External Router), Only one of I(name), I(id) or I(content) can be set.

content.description: Datastructure of the External Router to create. The format is defined by the I(content_format) parameter. It's the same datastructure that is returned on success in I(value).

state.description:
Default: present

Indicate what is the expected state of the External Router (present or not).

session.description: An existing AOS session as obtained by M(aos_login) module.

display_text.description:
Display text of the VPC.
If not set, C(name) will be used for creating.

vpc_offering.description:
Name of the VPC offering.
If not set, default VPC offering is used.

poll_async.description:
Default: True

Poll async jobs until job has finished.

name.description: Name of the VPC.

zone.description:
Name of the zone.
If not set, default zone is used.

tags.description:
List of tags. Tags are a list of dictionaries having keys C(key) and C(value).
For deleting all tags, set an empty list e.g. C(tags: []).

domain.description: Domain the VPC is related to.

project.description: Name of the project the VPC is related to.

state.description:
Default: present

State of the VPC.

tag.description:
List of tags. Tags are a list of dictionaries having keys C(key) and C(value).
For deleting all tags, set an empty list e.g. C(tags: []).

account.description: Account the VPC is related to.

cidr.description:
CIDR of the VPC, e.g. 10.1.0.0/16
All VPC guest networks' CIDRs must be within this CIDR.
Required on C(state=present).

network_domain.description:
Network domain for the VPC.
All networks inside the VPC will belong to this domain.

login_database.description: The database where login credentials are stored

replica_set.description: Replica set to connect to (automatically connects to primary for writes)

Optional URL to submit the notification to.

environment.description: Name of the environment being deployed, e.g. 'production'.

token.description: Your project access token.

user.description: User who deployed.

validate_certs.description:
Default: yes

If C(no), SSL certificates for the target url will not be validated. This should only be used on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

ovirt_users_facts.description: Retrieve facts about one or more oVirt users.

pattern.description:
Search term which is accepted by oVirt search backend.
For example to search user X use following pattern: name=X

enckey_base64.description:
Encrypted private key corresponding to the private key (e.g.
Those generated by an hsm such as thales nshield).

certificate_management_profile_ref.description: It is a reference to an object of type certificatemanagementprofile.

name.description: Name of the object.

dynamic_params.description: Dynamic parameters needed for certificate management profile.

url.description: Avi controller URL of the object.

enckey_name.description:
Name of the encrypted private key (e.g.
Those generated by an hsm such as thales nshield).

tenant_ref.description: It is a reference to an object of type tenant.

state.description:
Default: present

The state that should be applied on the entity.

hardwaresecuritymodulegroup_ref.description: It is a reference to an object of type hardwaresecuritymodulegroup.

key.description: Private key.

type.description:
Type of sslkeyandcertificate.
Default value when not specified in API or module is interpreted by Avi Controller as SSL_CERTIFICATE_TYPE_VIRTUALSERVICE.

uuid.description: Unique object identifier of the object.

chdir.description: cd into this directory before running make

params.description:
Default: none

Any extra parameters to pass to make

Default: none

The target to run

profitbricks_datacenter.description: This is a simple module that supports creating or removing vDCs. A vDC is required before you can create servers. This module has a dependency on profitbricks >= 1.0.0

name.description: The name of the virtual datacenter.

subscription_user.description: The ProfitBricks username. Overrides the PB_SUBSCRIPTION_ID environement variable.

description.description: The description of the virtual datacenter.

subscription_password.description: THe ProfitBricks password. Overrides the PB_PASSWORD environement variable.

state.description:
Default: present

create or terminate datacenters

wait_timeout.description:
Default: 600

how long before wait gives up, in seconds

avi_poolgroup.description:
This module is used to configure PoolGroup object
more examples at U(https://github.com/avinetworks/devops)

priority_labels_ref.description:
Uuid of the priority labels.
If not provided, pool group member priority label will be interpreted as a number with a larger number considered higher priority.
It is a reference to an object of type prioritylabels.

description.description: Description of pool group.

cloud_ref.description: It is a reference to an object of type cloud.

min_servers.description:
The minimum number of servers to distribute traffic to.
Default value when not specified in API or module is interpreted by Avi Controller as 0.

tenant_ref.description: It is a reference to an object of type tenant.

uuid.description: Uuid of the pool group.

created_by.description: Name of the user who created the object.

url.description: Avi controller URL of the object.

state.description:
Default: present

The state that should be applied on the entity.

cloud_config_cksum.description:
Checksum of cloud configuration for poolgroup.
Internally set by cloud connector.

members.description: List of pool group members object of type poolgroupmember.

fail_action.description:
Enable an action - close connection, http redirect, or local http response - when a pool group failure happens.
By default, a connection will be closed, in case the pool group experiences a failure.

deployment_policy_ref.description:
When setup autoscale manager will automatically promote new pools into production when deployment goals are met.
It is a reference to an object of type poolgroupdeploymentpolicy.

name.description: The name of the pool group.

panos_dag.description: Create a dynamic address group object in the firewall used for policy rules

username.description:
Default: admin

username for authentication

dag_name.description: name of the dynamic address group

password.description: password for authentication

ip_address.description: IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device

dag_filter.description: dynamic filter user by the dynamic address group

name.description: Name of the parameter to update.

login_user.description:
Default: dbadmin

The username used to authenticate with.

value.description: Value of the parameter to be set.

cluster.description:
Default: localhost

Name of the Vertica cluster.

login_password.description: The password used to authenticate with.

port.description:
Default: 5433

Vertica cluster port to connect to.

network_policy.description: Network policy specifies layer 2 security settings for a portgroup such as promiscuous mode, where guest adapter listens to all the packets, MAC address changes and forged transmits. Settings are promiscuous_mode, forged_transmits, mac_changes

vlan_id.description: VLAN ID to assign to portgroup

nclu.description: Interface to the Network Command Line Utility, developed to make it easier to configure operating systems running ifupdown2 and Quagga, such as Cumulus Linux. Command documentation is available at U(https://docs.cumulusnetworks.com/display/DOCS/Network+Command+Line+Utility)

commands.description: A list of strings containing the net commands to run. Mutually exclusive with I(template).

description.description:
Default: Ansible-originated commit

Commit description that will be recorded to the commit log if I(commit) or I(atomic) are true.

abort.description: Boolean. When true, perform a 'net abort' before the block. This cleans out any uncommitted changes in the buffer. Mutually exclusive with I(atomic).

atomic.description: When true, equivalent to both I(commit) and I(abort) being true. Mutually exclusive with I(commit) and I(atomic).

template.description: A single, multi-line string with jinja2 formatting. This string will be broken by lines, and each line will be run through net. Mutually exclusive with I(commands).

commit.description: When true, performs a 'net commit' at the end of the block. Mutually exclusive with I(atomic).

docker_image.description: Build, load or pull an image, making the image available for creating containers. Also supports tagging an image into a repository and archiving an image to a .tar file.

archive_path.description: Use with state C(present) to archive an image to a .tar file.

build_path.description: Use with state 'present' to build an image. Will be the path to a directory containing the context and Dockerfile for building an image.

force.description: Use with state I(absent) to un-tag and remove all images matching the specified name. Use with state C(present) to build, load or pull an image when the image already exists.

name.description: Image name. Name format will be one of: name, repository/name, registry_server:port/name. When pushing or pulling an image the name can optionally include the tag by appending ':tag_name'.

repository.description: Full path to a repository. Use with state C(present) to tag the image into the repository. Expects format I(repository:tag). If no tag is provided, will use the value of the C(tag) parameter or I(latest).

pull.description:
Default: True

When building an image downloads any updates to the FROM image in Dockerfile.

container_limits.description: A dictionary of limits applied to each container created by the build process.

dockerfile.description:
Default: Dockerfile

Use with state C(present) to provide an alternate name for the Dockerfile to use when building an image.

nocache.description: Do not use cache when building an image.

load_path.description: Use with state C(present) to load an image from a .tar file.

use_tls.description: DEPRECATED. Whether to use tls to connect to the docker server. Set to C(no) when TLS will not be used. Set to C(encrypt) to use TLS. And set to C(verify) to use TLS and verify that the server's certificate is valid for the server. NOTE: If you specify this option, it will set the value of the tls or tls_verify parameters.

state.description:
Default: present

Make assertions about the state of an image.
When C(absent) an image will be removed. Use the force option to un-tag and remove all images matching the provided name.
When C(present) check if an image exists using the provided name and tag. If the image is not found or the force option is used, the image will either be pulled, built or loaded. By default the image will be pulled from Docker Hub. To build the image, provide a path value set to a directory containing a context and Dockerfile. To load an image, specify load_path to provide a path to an archive file. To tag an image to a repository, provide a repository path. If the name contains a repository path, it will be pushed.
NOTE: C(build) is DEPRECATED and will be removed in release 2.3. Specifying C(build) will behave the same as C(present).

tag.description:
Default: latest

Used to select an image when pulling. Will be added to the image when pushing, tagging or building. Defaults to I(latest).
If C(name) parameter format is I(name:tag), then tag value from C(name) will take precedence.

buildargs.description:
Provide a dictionary of C(key:value) build arguments that map to Dockerfile ARG directive.
Docker expects the value to be a string. For convenience any non-string values will be converted to strings.
Requires Docker API >= 1.21 and docker-py >= 1.7.0.

rm.description:
Default: True

Remove intermediate containers after build.

push.description: Push the image to the registry. Specify the registry as part of the I(name) or I(repository) parameter.

path.description: Use with state 'present' to build an image. Will be the path to a directory containing the context and Dockerfile for building an image.

http_timeout.description: Timeout for HTTP requests during the image build operation. Provide a positive integer value for the number of seconds.

startup_query_interval.description: Query interval used when the IGMP process starts up. The range is from 1 to 18000. The default is 31.

report_llg.description: Configures report-link-local-groups. Enables sending reports for groups in 224.0.0.0/24. Reports are always sent for nonlink local groups. By default, reports are not sent for link local groups.

last_member_qrt.description: Sets the query interval waited after sending membership reports before the software deletes the group state. Values can range from 1 to 25 seconds. The default is 1 second.

group_timeout.description: Sets the group membership timeout for IGMPv2. Values can range from 3 to 65,535 seconds. The default is 260 seconds.

robustness.description: Sets the robustness variable. Values can range from 1 to 7. The default is 2.

startup_query_count.description: Query count used when the IGMP process starts up. The range is from 1 to 10. The default is 2.

oif_routemap.description: Configure a routemap for static outgoing interface (OIF).

immediate_leave.description: Enables the device to remove the group entry from the multicast routing table immediately upon receiving a leave message for the group. Use this command to minimize the leave latency of IGMPv2 group memberships on a given IGMP interface because the device does not send group-specific queries. The default is disabled.

oif_source.description: Configure a source for static outgoing interface (OIF).

state.description:
Default: present

Manages desired state of the resource.

version.description: IGMP version. It can be 2 or 3.

oif_prefix.description: Configure a prefix for static outgoing interface (OIF).

interface.description: The full interface name for IGMP configuration. e.g. I(Ethernet1/2).

querier_timeout.description: Sets the querier timeout that the software uses when deciding to take over as the querier. Values can range from 1 to 65535 seconds. The default is 255 seconds.

last_member_query_count.description: Sets the number of times that the software sends an IGMP query in response to a host leave message. Values can range from 1 to 5. The default is 2.

query_interval.description: Sets the frequency at which the software sends IGMP host query messages. Values can range from 1 to 18000 seconds. he default is 125 seconds.

query_mrt.description: Sets the response time advertised in IGMP queries. Values can range from 1 to 25 seconds. The default is 10 seconds.

datacenter.description: Destination datacenter for the deploy operation

uuid.description:
UUID of the instance to manage if known, this is VMware's unique identifier.
This is required if name is not supplied.

description.description: Define an arbitrary description to attach to snapshot.

state.description: Manage snapshots attached to a specific virtual machine.

snapshot_name.description:
Sets the snapshot name to manage.
This param is required only if state is not C(remove_all)

name_match.description:
Default: first

If multiple VMs matching the name, use the first or last found

name.description: Name of the VM to work with

clc_group.description: Create or delete Server Groups at Centurylink Centurylink Cloud

description.description: A description of the Server Group

parent.description: The parent group of the server group. If parent is not provided, it creates the group at top level.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether to create or delete the group

location.description: Datacenter to create the group in. If location is not provided, the group gets created in the default datacenter associated with the account

wait.description:
Default: True

Whether to wait for the tasks to finish before returning.

name.description: The name of the Server Group

udm_dns_record.description: This module allows to manage dns records on a univention corporate server (UCS). It uses the python API of the UCS to create a new object or edit it.

data.description: Additional data for this record, e.g. ['a': '192.0.2.1']. Required if C(state=present).

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the dns record is present or not.

type.description: Define the record type. C(host_record) is a A or AAAA record, C(alias) is a CNAME, C(ptr_record) is a PTR record, C(srv_record) is a SRV record and C(txt_record) is a TXT record.

name.description: Name of the record, this is also the DNS record. E.g. www for www.example.com.

zone.description: Corresponding DNS zone for this record, e.g. example.com.

panos_address.description: Create address service object of different types [IP Range, FQDN, or IP Netmask].

username.description:
Default: admin

Username credentials to use for authentication.

description.description:
Default: None

Description of the address object.

ip_address.description: IP address (or hostname) of PAN-OS device being configured.

tag.description:
Default: None

Tag of the address object.

address_name.description:
Default: None

Human readable name of the address.

address.description:
Default: None

IP address with or without mask, range, or FQDN.

commit.description:
Default: True

Commit configuration to the Firewall if it is changed.

password.description: Password credentials to use for authentication.

type.description:
Default: ip-nemask

This is the type of the object created.

This module is used to configure NetworkProfile object
more examples at U(https://github.com/avinetworks/devops)

description.description: User defined description for the object.

url.description: Avi controller URL of the object.

tenant_ref.description: It is a reference to an object of type tenant.

uuid.description: Uuid of the network profile.

state.description:
Default: present

The state that should be applied on the entity.

name.description: The name of the network profile.

ohai.description: Similar to the M(facter) module, this runs the I(Ohai) discovery program (U(http://wiki.opscode.com/display/chef/Ohai)) on the remote host and returns JSON inventory data. I(Ohai) data is a bit more verbose and nested than I(facter).

na_cdot_svm.description: Create or destroy svm on NetApp cDOT

root_volume_security_style.description:
Security Style of the root volume.
When specified as part of the vserver-create, this field represents the security style for the Vserver root volume.
When specified as part of vserver-get-iter call, this will return the list of matching Vservers.
Possible values are 'unix', 'ntfs', 'mixed'.
The 'unified' security style, which applies only to Infinite Volumes, cannot be applied to a Vserver's root volume.
Valid options are "unix" for NFS, "ntfs" for CIFS, "mixed" for Mixed, "unified" for Unified.
Required when C(state=present)

state.description: Whether the specified SVM should exist or not.

root_volume_aggregate.description:
The aggregate on which the root volume will be created.
Required when C(state=present).

name.description: The name of the SVM to manage.

root_volume.description: Root volume of the SVM. Required when C(state=present).

azure_rm_securitygroup_facts.description: Get facts for a specific security group or all security groups within a resource group.

name.description: Only show results for a specific security group.

resource_group.description: Name of the resource group to use.

tags.description: Limit results by providing a list of tags. Format tags as 'key' or 'key:value'.

user.description: Manage user accounts and user attributes.

comment.description: Optionally sets the description (aka I(GECOS)) of user account.

ssh_key_bits.description:
Default: default set by ssh-keygen

Optionally specify number of bits in SSH key to create.

update_password.description:
Default: always

C(always) will update passwords if they differ.  C(on_create) will only set the password for newly created users.

non_unique.description:
Default: no

Optionally when used with the -u option, this option allows to change the user ID to a non-unique value.

force.description:
Default: no

When used with C(state=absent), behavior is as with C(userdel --force).

ssh_key_type.description:
Default: rsa

Optionally specify the type of SSH key to generate. Available SSH key types will depend on implementation present on target host.

ssh_key_passphrase.description: Set a passphrase for the SSH key.  If no passphrase is provided, the SSH key will default to having no passphrase.

home.description: Optionally set the user's home directory.

skeleton.description: Optionally set a home skeleton directory. Requires createhome option!

append.description:
Default: no

If C(yes), will only add groups, not set them to just the list in I(groups).

uid.description: Optionally sets the I(UID) of the user.

ssh_key_comment.description:
Default: ansible-generated on $HOSTNAME

Optionally define the comment for the SSH key.

group.description: Optionally sets the user's primary group (takes a group name).

system.description:
Default: no

When creating an account, setting this to C(yes) makes the user a system account.  This setting cannot be changed on existing users.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the account should exist or not, taking action if the state is different from what is stated.

expires.description:
Default: None

An expiry time for the user in epoch, it will be ignored on platforms that do not support this. Currently supported on Linux and FreeBSD.

ssh_key_file.description:
Default: .ssh/id_rsa

Optionally specify the SSH key filename. If this is a relative filename then it will be relative to the user's home directory.

user.description: Name of the user to create, remove or modify.

groups.description: Puts the user in this comma-delimited list of groups. When set to the empty string ('groups='), the user is removed from all groups except the primary group.

move_home.description:
Default: no

If set to C(yes) when used with C(home=), attempt to move the user's home directory to the specified directory if it isn't there already.

password.description: Optionally set the user's password to this crypted value.  See the user example in the github examples directory for what this looks like in a playbook. See U(http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/faq.html#how-do-i-generate-crypted-passwords-for-the-user-module) for details on various ways to generate these password values. Note on Darwin system, this value has to be cleartext. Beware of security issues.

seuser.description: Optionally sets the seuser type (user_u) on selinux enabled systems.

name.description: Name of the user to create, remove or modify.

createhome.description:
Default: yes

Unless set to C(no), a home directory will be made for the user when the account is created or if the home directory does not exist.

remove.description:
Default: no

When used with C(state=absent), behavior is as with C(userdel --remove).

login_class.description: Optionally sets the user's login class for FreeBSD, OpenBSD and NetBSD systems.

generate_ssh_key.description:
Default: no

Whether to generate a SSH key for the user in question. This will B(not) overwrite an existing SSH key.

quantum_router_gateway.description: Creates/Removes a gateway interface from the router, used to associate a external network with a router to route external traffic.

region_name.description:
Default: None

Name of the region

network_name.description:
Default: None

Name of the external network which should be attached to the router.

login_tenant_name.description:
Default: yes

The tenant name of the login user

state.description:
Default: present

Indicate desired state of the resource

auth_url.description:
Default: http://127.0.0.1:35357/v2.0/

The keystone URL for authentication

login_password.description:
Default: yes

Password of login user

login_username.description:
Default: admin

login username to authenticate to keystone

router_name.description:
Default: None

Name of the router to which the gateway should be attached.

ovirt_hosts_facts.description: Retrieve facts about one or more oVirt hosts.

pattern.description:
Search term which is accepted by oVirt search backend.
For example to search host X from datacenter Y use following pattern: name=X and datacenter=Y

gcdns_zone.description: Creates or removes managed zones in Google Cloud DNS.

description.description: An arbitrary text string to use for the zone description.

zone.description:
The DNS domain name of the zone.
This is NOT the Google Cloud DNS zone ID (e.g., example-com). If you attempt to specify a zone ID, this module will attempt to create a TLD and will fail.

service_account_email.description: The e-mail address for a service account with access to Google Cloud DNS.

pem_file.description:
The path to the PEM file associated with the service account email.
This option is deprecated and may be removed in a future release. Use I(credentials_file) instead.

state.description:
Default: present

Whether the given zone should or should not be present.

credentials_file.description: The path to the JSON file associated with the service account email.

project_id.description: The Google Cloud Platform project ID to use.

name.description:
The DNS domain name of the zone.
This is NOT the Google Cloud DNS zone ID (e.g., example-com). If you attempt to specify a zone ID, this module will attempt to create a TLD and will fail.

pn_vrouterif.description:
Execute vrouter-interface-add, vrouter-interface-remove, vrouter-interface-modify command.
You configure interfaces to vRouter services on a fabric, cluster, standalone switch or virtual network(VNET).

pn_nic_enable.description: Specify if the NIC is enabled or not

pn_clipassword.description: Provide login password if user is not root.

pn_exclusive.description: Specify if the interface is exclusive to the configuration. Exclusive means that other configurations cannot use the interface. Exclusive is specified when you configure the interface as span interface and allows higher throughput through the interface.

pn_nic_str.description: Specify the type of NIC. Used for vrouter-interface remove/modify.

pn_vrouter_name.description: Specify the name of the vRouter interface.

pn_vrrp_adv_int.description: Specify a VRRP advertisement interval in milliseconds. The range is from 30 to 40950 with a default value of 1000.

pn_vrrp_priority.description: Specify the priority for the VRRP interface. This is a value between 1 (lowest) and 255 (highest).

pn_alias.description: Specify an alias for the interface.

pn_secondary_macs.description: Specify a secondary MAC address for the interface.

pn_cliusername.description: Provide login username if user is not root.

pn_interface_ip.description: Specify the IP address of the interface in x.x.x.x/n format.

state.description: State the action to perform. Use 'present' to add vrouter interface, 'absent' to remove vrouter interface and 'update' to modify vrouter interface.

pn_vrrp_id.description: Specify the ID for the VRRP interface. The IDs on both vRouters must be the same IS number.

pn_vlan.description: Specify the VLAN identifier. This is a value between 1 and 4092.

pn_interface.description: Specify if the interface is management, data or span interface.

pn_l3port.description: Specify a Layer 3 port for the interface.

pn_vxlan.description: Specify the VXLAN identifier. This is a value between 1 and 16777215.

pn_cliswitch.description: Target switch to run the cli on.

pn_assignment.description: Specify the DHCP method for IP address assignment.

if commit should be synchronous

timeout for commit job

temporary.description: Specifies that the property value is temporary. Temporary property values do not persist across reboots.

name.description: Specifies the name of the property we want to manage.

nic.description: Specifies the IP interface we want to manage.

value.description: Specifies the value we want to set for the property.

state.description:
Default: present

Set or reset the property value.

interface.description: Specifies the IP interface we want to manage.

protocol.description: Specifies the procotol for which we want to manage properties.

property.description: Specifies the name of the property we want to manage.

win_reg_stat.description:
Like M(win_file), M(win_reg_stat) will return whether the key/property exists.
It also returns the sub keys and properties of the key specified.
If specifying a property name through I(property), it will return the information specific for that property.

name.description: The registry property name to get information for, the return json will not include the sub_keys and properties entries for the I(key) specified.

value.description: The registry property name to get information for, the return json will not include the sub_keys and properties entries for the I(key) specified.

key.description: The full registry key path including the hive to search for.

entry.description: The registry property name to get information for, the return json will not include the sub_keys and properties entries for the I(key) specified.

path.description: The full registry key path including the hive to search for.

property.description: The registry property name to get information for, the return json will not include the sub_keys and properties entries for the I(key) specified.

whether exchange is durable or not

quorum.description: Monitor quorum value when monitor_type is m_of_n

name.description: Name of the pki profile.

An FRMI of the package(s) to be installed/removed/updated.
Multiple packages may be specified, separated by C(,).

web_index.description: Sets an object to be presented as the HTTP index page when accessed by the CDN URL

container.description: The container to use for container or metadata operations.

Default: DFW

Region to create an instance in

state.description:
Default: present

Indicate desired state of the resource

clear_meta.description:
Default: no

Optionally clear existing metadata when applying metadata to existing containers. Selecting this option is only appropriate when setting type=meta

meta.description: A hash of items to set as metadata values on a container

ttl.description: In seconds, set a container-wide TTL for all objects cached on CDN edge nodes. Setting a TTL is only appropriate for containers that are public
